articles.title: Argentina opposition leads in key seats in congressional primaries, early results show
articles.description: Argentina's main opposition party held leads in the country's capital and the important province of Buenos Aires in congressional primary elections on Sunday, early results showed, indicating a strong challenge to the ruling Peronist coalition.
articles.content: Argentina's main opposition party held leads in the country's capital and the important province of Buenos Aires in congressional primary elections on Sunday, early results showed, indicating a strong challenge to the ruling Peronist coalition. The c... [3033 chars]

articles.title: Fact-checking works to undercut misinformation in many countries
articles.description: From Argentina to Nigeria, fact-checks limited false beliefs.
articles.content: In the wake of the flood of misinformation that's drowning the US, lots of organizations have turned to fact-checks. Many newsrooms set up dedicated fact-check groups, and some independent organizations were formed to provide the service. We get live... [4927 chars]

articles.title: Cry with me, Argentina: teary Messi delights fans and breaks Pelé’s record
articles.description: The country’s shirt once weighed Messi down, but the hat-trick against Bolivia and Copa America win have sealed his legacy
articles.content: Lionel Messi broke down in tears of joy after scoring three goals against Bolivia in a World Cup qualifier played in Buenos Aires’s Monumental stadium. The nation wept with him, in a communion of devotees relishing their favourite game, finally, the ... [5340 chars]

articles.title: Live Rugby Championship: Argentina out to repeat miracle upset against All Blacks
articles.description: Live Rugby Championship: Argentina out to repeat miracle upset against All Blacks
articles.content:
Welcome to live coverage of New Zealand vs Argentina on the Gold Coast. Kick-off: 5:05pm.
It was the upset that breathed life into the Tri Nations last year, as Argentina beat the All Blacks for the first time in western Sydney.
Can they do it again?... [3152 chars]

articles.title: New movie explores global complicity in Argentina's 'dirty war'
articles.description: Argentina’s military dictatorship led to killings and disappearances of at least 30,000 people. The film "Azor" explores the complicity of even neutral countries.
articles.content: The Argentine military dictatorship's reign of terror involved torture and killings, leading to the disappearance of at least 30,000 people. Now 45 years later, the Swiss filmmaker Andreas Fontana takes the tragic Latin American historical events to ... [9275 chars]

articles.title: UPDATE 2-Argentina agrees short-term contract with Parana River dredger -gov't source
